channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Second U.S. carrier nears Middle East, as Trump pressures Iran to make a deal
item.description: A second American aircraft carrier moved closer to the Middle East Thursday, as President Trump remains noncommittal about whether he'll use force against Iran.
item.content:encoded: A second American aircraft carrier moved closer to the Middle East Thursday, as President Trump remains noncommittal about whether he'll use force against Iran.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Former U.S. Navy commander talks about the US military buildup near Iran
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks retired Vice Admiral Kevin Donegan, a former Navy commander in the Middle East, about the U.S. military buildup near Iran.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin asks retired Vice Admiral Kevin Donegan, a former Navy commander in the Middle East, about the U.S. military buildup near Iran.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Trump visits Georgia to promote economy to woo voters ahead of midterms
item.description: President Trump went to Georgia Thursday for his latest domestic stop, where he pitched the economy and touted his tariff policies to voters.
item.content:encoded: President Trump went to Georgia Thursday for his latest domestic stop, where he pitched the economy and touted his tariff policies to voters.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: U.S. Commission on Fine Arts approves Trump's White House ballroom plan
item.description: The U.S. Commission on Fine Arts, which is packed with President Trump's allies, voted to approve the new White House ballroom project pursued by Trump.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Commission on Fine Arts, which is packed with President Trump's allies, voted to approve the new White House ballroom project pursued by Trump.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Trump unveils big plans for Gaza at Board of Peace's first meeting
item.description: President Trump hosted the first ever Board of Peace meeting Thursday in Washington, D.C., with about 40 countries attending.
item.content:encoded: President Trump hosted the first ever Board of Peace meeting Thursday in Washington, D.C., with about 40 countries attending.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: 'We were scared': Man recalls the night he nearly launched a nuclear missile
item.description: In 1974, Lt. Colonel Randall Lanning manned the launch controls that could deploy nuclear weapons in the event of a Soviet attack. He looks back at one night that's still etched in his memory.
item.content:encoded: In 1974, Lt. Colonel Randall Lanning manned the launch controls that could deploy nuclear weapons in the event of a Soviet attack. He looks back at one night that's still etched in his memory.
item.dc:creator: Esther Honig

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: A second U.S. aircraft carrier moved closer to the Middle East Thursday, President Trump's Board of Peace held its first meeting, former Prince Andrew released after spending day in police custody.
item.content:encoded: A second U.S. aircraft carrier moved closer to the Middle East Thursday, President Trump's Board of Peace held its first meeting, former Prince Andrew released after spending day in police custody.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: New documentary explores the life and career of 'the fifth Beatle' Billy Preston
item.description: John Lennon called keyboardist Billy Preston "the fifth Beatle." But his talents couldn't help him outrun his demons, as told in a new documentary, "Billy Preston: That's the Way God Planned It."
item.content:encoded: John Lennon called keyboardist Billy Preston "the fifth Beatle." But his talents couldn't help him outrun his demons, as told in a new documentary, "Billy Preston: That's the Way God Planned It."
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Commerce Department report will share how much the U.S. economy grew last year
item.description: A report from the Commerce Department on Friday will share how much the U.S. economy grew last year. Growth has been fueled by solid consumer spending and business investment in AI.
item.content:encoded: A report from the Commerce Department on Friday will share how much the U.S. economy grew last year. Growth has been fueled by solid consumer spending and business investment in AI.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Iranian authorities crack down on mourners trying to honor people killed in protests
item.description: Iranian authorities are cracking down on mourners as they try to memorialize their loved ones who were killed in last month's protests.
item.content:encoded: Iranian authorities are cracking down on mourners as they try to memorialize their loved ones who were killed in last month's protests.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam
